content.question:
The superintendent of a large school district wants to estimate the percent of district residents who support the building of a new middle school. To gather data, the superintendent will select a random sample of district residents.
Which of the following is the most appropriate method for creating such an estimate?

choices.label: A one-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a sample proportion
A two-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a difference between population proportions
A two-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a population proportion
A one-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a difference between population proportions
A one-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a population proportion

content.answer: A one-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a population proportion
